intro: Cybianthus rostratus, commonly known as the rostrated bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology, including its elongated floral tube, makes it a subject of botanical interest. Cybianthus rostratus is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
